title: Distressed Blackletter from MatchCreative.com
content:
Anyone know what this distressed blackletter is that Match Creative is using:

[http://www.matchcreative.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101405/http:/www.matchcreative.com/)

Samples attached.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101405/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_61.jpg) | 7.23 KB |
| [Picture 2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101405/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%202_19.jpg) | 4.52 KB |
| [Picture 3.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101405/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%203_11.jpg) | 4.32 KB |

 [‹ From the Stockholm National Gallery...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101405/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48449 "Go to previous forum topic") [No Country For Old Men Cover Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101405/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48448 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Spencer Cross

comments.content: Reminds me of [Jukebox’s blackletters](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101405/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=search/results.aspx?keyword=blackletter%20jukebox&producttype=TYP) though none are a match.
I bet this one is [**Archive Black Title**](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/archivetype/archive-black-title/). One of my personal favourites.
Is it me, or is that site designed for the designer, rather than the person actually looking for design talent?

acnapyx: Thanks! Looks like it to me, but even if it’s not that’s exactly the kind of thing I was looking for!

aluminum: Maybe, but Match specializes in staffing for design studios, ad agencies and in house creative departments so most of the time their clientele _is_ other designers and creatives.

—  
_Spencer Cross_  
[professional] [http://tokyofarm.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101405/http:/tokyofarm.com/)  
[communal] [http://kernspiracy.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101405/http:/kernspiracy.com/)  
[cultural] [http://la.metblogs.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101405/http:/la.metblogs.com/)

“but Match specializes in staffing for design studios, ad agencies and in house creative departments”

Ah, well, in that case, I suppose their visuals makes perfect sense then.
